articles.description: In this article, Georgii Perepecho explains the most common React Query features that you need to be familiar with when creating a real-life application that is stable when testing.
articles.title: Building The Real App With React Query

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: What goes into creating a successful design system? How can you take your testing workflow to the next level? And what smart interface design patterns could help you enhance your UIs? Let’s figure it out. With our [online workshops on front-end and UX](https://smashingconf.com/online-workshops).
articles.title: Upcoming Online Workshops: January – May 2022

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Anton Tyschenko)
articles.description: Every once in a while, we publish [freebies](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/category/freebies) related to different occasions and themes. We hope that with this icon set, everyone will be able to find their own use case for these icons in particular. Today, we present to you three icon sets designed by the creative folks at GraphicSurf — all free for personal and commercial use.
articles.title: Freebie: Wayfinding Icon Sets (164 Icons, PNG, SVG, AI, EPS)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: We’ll explore fluid typography principles, use-cases, implementation with CSS clamp() and an interactive fluid typography calculator.
articles.title: Modern Fluid Typography Using CSS Clamp

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Luis Ouriach)
articles.description: In [Part 1](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/01/ten-tips-aspiring-designer-beginners-part1/), Luis Ouriach shared advice he wished he had when starting out in his career. In this second and last part of this series, Luis continues sharing tips that helped him grow and become a better designer throughout the years.
articles.title: Ten Tips For Aspiring Designer Beginners (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Daniel Don)
articles.description: If you’re a developer who’s thinking about building a platform that requires a code editor in one form or another, then this article is for you. This article explains how to create a web code editor that displays the result in real time with the help of some HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
articles.title: Building A Web Code Editor

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Kate Kalcevich)
articles.description: Accessibility must be a permanent program within organizations, much like security. In this article, Kate Kalcevich shares tips on which skills and questions to keep in mind when hiring for digital accessibility roles.
articles.title: How To Hire For Digital Accessibility Roles

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ahmad Shadeed)
articles.description: In this article, we’ll be taking a closer look at two gradients: `conic-gradient` and `radial-gradient`. You’ll see how each one of them works in detail, what the differences and similarities are between them, how and where to use them, and some use cases for each.
articles.title: A Deep CSS Dive Into Radial And Conic Gradients

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Scott Himmer)
articles.description: Product roadmaps are often treated as a series of checkboxes. But they are more than that. In this article, Scott Himmer explains how internal partnerships, research, design systems, and regular touch bases can help make sure that your product roadmap is a successful one.
articles.title: Changing A Tire On A Moving Car (Or How To Improve Product Roadmaps)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Luis Ouriach)
articles.description: In this article (the first part in a series of two), Luis Ouriach shares advice that he wishes he has when starting out in his career. These tips come from his experience as a user interface and product designer for close to ten years, and if you’re starting just now, then read on!
articles.title: Ten Tips For Aspiring Designer Beginners (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Aleksandra Nagornaia)
articles.description: Figma has advanced enough where it now supports some powerful concepts that can help with the flexibility and maintainability of a design system. articles.title: Composition-Based Design System In Figma

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)

articles.title: New Year, Fresh Desktop (January 2022 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Boag)
